result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian E Kirkland

defendant.name: Kirkland, Brian E
defendant.address: N3973 County Highway E, Juneau, WI 53039

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brian E Kirkland in court with attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to have this case dismissed and read-in to 14CF667, Court grants the State's motion.

Defendant Brian E Kirkland in court with attorney Reisha Mitchell.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. Information filed by the State. Reading waived.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED by Defense. Defense requests 14CF667 be set for jury status/trial and 14CF1277 trail along. Bail stands as fixed. 
  Hearing scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to have no contact with alleged business listed in the Criminal Complaint. Defendant to continue with present treatment.

Defendant Brian E Kirkland in court.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Mitchell states she has not been appointed on this matter but states she will be representing the defendant. Criminal complaint received - reading waived. Bail addressed. Prelim time limits tolled. Defense advises they will waive the prelim on the next date. Court sets bail at $5000.00 signature bond with conditions. Court will give another date.  Hearing scheduled for December 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
